2 hours ago, parv kerman said:

how do you get to mun? Your standard way.

1) expend a lot of effort throwing yourself into it's path

2) spend no effort at all while intentionally missing it for a while

3) give up trying to miss it, and with a sigh and a puff, hit it

 

Isn't that everyone's standard?
With some sort of rocket propelled vehicle, generally.
Moved over to Gameplay Questions.

Generally speaking, the easiest way to get to the Mun is to get yourself into an orbit, usually around 70-100km, and when the Mun rises over the horizon of your orbit you start your burn until you intercept it.

When I launch to the Mun, sometimes I also want to deliver an empty fuel tank to LKO at the same time. So on those occasions I just do a simple launch to LKO, decouple my Mun rocket upper stage from the empty fuel tank, and make a maneuver node the standard way to get me the rest of the way to the Mun.

But most of the time I do like MDZhB and just launch straight up when I'm 40 to 60 degrees ahead of the Mun. It's very fast, easy, and efficient.

Get into orbit, open map view and orient so that the Mun is in about the two o'clock position and burn to push my apoapsis out to the 12 o'clock position when my vehicle is at 6 o'clock. I may or may not use a manoeuvre node , depending how I'm feeling.

I burn an obscene amount of fuel while actiavely directing the exhaust until I get into the Mun's SOI. Then the pilot is unemployed when he gets back because the Kerbin fuel market crashed from burning all that fuel. I like wasting fuel.

mk3 command pod with a lot of rockomax, orbit where my periapsis won't go up, and then use a maneuver node to get an encounter, run out of fuel on descent, scream at myself, promise that won't happen again, repeat.

Pretty standard.

Burn at the night side with about 3-4 thousand delta-V in your ship, and remember, burn straight up! Just kidding, burning straight up isn't super efficient, burn at about a 30-40 degree angle help breaks the bonds of Kerbin's gravity.

With an SSTO.
I just posted my quick and dirty "get to the Mun" explanation in another thread. Not going to re-post here, but you can look at it. I hope it helps

I make a rocket in the shape of the Apollo 11. I use a couple of mods. One of the parts is a space from 2.5m to 3.75 m with Liquid fuel and oxidiser in it. Here are just a few details.

I use 3 parachutes.

I use 4 1x6 solar panels on my service module and 4 lights

I use 5 vector engines for stage 1, not a single mammoth engine. ( More thrust and vector power )

I use a gravity assist.

Ok when I'm not doing SSTOs, I launch into orbit, burn prograde when the Mun is on the horizon, burn retrograde at Mun PE to circularize and do a super in-efficient landing. Then I take off, and turn to 45 degrees almost immediately. Once high enough, I turn to the horizon and get the AP to about 10km. Then I circularize and do a prograde burn retrograde to the planet's rotation. Then ditch remaining fuel tanks before re-entering. Turn off SAS when I hit the atmosphere and re-enter safely.
As efficiently as possible, apparently unlike a lot of people...
